* Poor boy, you know, you never once fooled me... You put your trust, in the thought that grace was on your side It's such a beautiful day to hide! Coming back from a birthday party... I'm as unsatisfied as usual... But let's go back to yesterday. R , that I haden't seen in ages, had called me to invite me to go to the rugby friday meal and afterwards at the bar. We flirted a bit the first times we met but then I found someone else, he too and he's still with her. It was not the big evening, but I laughed, I had some free beers and even camembert with red wine :). Then it was already late for me but I decided to go to the bar too, have a drink and then go away. L bet that I wouldn't leave before 4am... (I knew I would win for sure, but this is another story) At the bar there were already some other people - among them A : I would like to know him better (like: a frriend) but I've noticed any move toward him misleads him on my intentions... - anyway, this is another another story. And after a good non-alcoholic orange juice, it was 1am so I said goodbyes - but R told me "I'm leaving too" so we went outside together, chatted (?) a bit and when I was ready to leave he asked me for a real kiss. Oh crap. No guy, when you get older (he's 4 years older than me)... 8 Months ago, before Arwen, I guess I would have said yes, tasted it and enjoied it, without thinking too much about any consequences. On the way back home, I put Common Rotation as loud as possible but then I started thinking about M and it was worse! Result: headache this morning Noticeable events: Rugby world cup in Australia: France-Japan 51-27 (or something like that). Their new tight-fitting T-shirts are... tigth-fitting. Very good idea indeed :D. Colza: she was rather nice today and for the first 20 minutes of "lunge-work" (?) she did everything as I was asking, it was perfect. Stop, walk, trot, canter... Yeah! Then I went to the supermarket to spend some money on needed things, like food, and on un-needed things like kitchen gadgets... Cooked a bit, so I brought to A : a tuna cake, an olive and bacon cake, a chocolate cake and a fromage frais & salmon terrine. I'm proud for once :) Good food, good drinks, talks with people I've known since high school and others I'd never met before... It was great, but I have to say after a couple of hours those visions of happy couples annoy me a bit. So... I left. And as always, on the way back, Common Rotation thoughts flooding my mind. Tonight at 2:30 am it's 8:30 pm in Long Island, the CoRo gig at the Oyster Fest is over but I so wish I could have been there... I want to be a Common Rotation groupie! I want to go to nearky each of their gigs, like I would go to the swimming-pool once a week, but each time to a different swimming-pool, with various water temperature. I want to be French, live in France and at the same time be able to fly anywhere I want (without any jetlag of course!). I should have picked my favorite band in the local ones, like Weepers Circus for instance: I saw them once some years ago at the Fête de la Musique (June, 21st, each year, everywhere in France). Now, they're kinda famous with gigs all around France. But, more important I have to find a solution to my M problem. This is what you get when you don't have the morning talk - or when you don't have any talk, like what happened with N . Well, tomorrow will be short, there's some horse-riding in the countryside with Jim, and some homework. So, here endeth the rant (plus, Buffy on TV!)

* She saved me from a slow process of mental sinking during my first year in Marseille. It has been ages since I've listened to this CD ( When the Pawn... ), and tonight while working I put it in the CD player. It was a strange feeling, because her songs are at the same time gentle with me and they remind me of some difficult memories too. And in the end there's this song... I Know . Listening and singing along to it, I realised something: it made me think about Spike and Buffy. Partly because I miss Buffy (cant' watch DVDs anymore, nothing on TV, no new season to expect) and partly because I had this image stuck in my head, where Buffy sleeps in Spike's arms, after she's been evicted from the Power Slayers... [here you can note how involved I felt in what I was doing...] Take a look at this, changing the point of vision (she he) - here it's Spike speaking, not Fiona: So be it, I'm your crowbar If that's what I am so far Until you get out of this mess And I will pretend That you don't know your sins Until you are ready to confess But all the time, all the time I'll know, I'll know And you can use my skin To bury secrets in And I will settle you down And at my own suggestion, I will ask no questions While I do my thing in the background But all the time, all the time I'll know, I'll know Baby-i can't help you out, while she's still around So for the time being, I'm being patient And amidst the bitterness If you'll just consider this-even if it don't make sense All the time-give it time And when the crowd becomes your burden And you've early closed your curtains I'll wait by the backstage door While you try to find the lines to speak your mind And pry it open, hoping for an encore And if it gets too late, for me to wait For to to find you love me, and tell me so It's ok, don't need to say it. I have found a fairly good french transcription somewhere, if among the no-ones who are reading this there's someone who'd like to read it.

This will probably be one of the few like that :) I'm not artsy, I'm not folky, I'm not the slightest bit lonely I'm not well-read, I'm not well-put, but theere's something burning in my gut I'm lad at someone, I'm mad at someone Common Rotation 'Did A Verse End?'
